A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I had very few expectations for this movie\, but I at least figured it'd be on par with The Force Awakens and Rogue One. The Last Jedi is a Star Wars movie I walked away from without any feelings of any sort. Much like the light and dark sides of the force\, the movie was a struggle between the nostalgia of the old Star Wars movies and the new order of the Star Wars movies to come. The nostalgia provided the biggest spark in this movie for me\, personally\, but even that was subdued by the lackluster demise of characters. Similar to the second episode of the original trilogy\, The Empire Strikes Back\, the movie ended on a down note and I don't know if anything will get me remotely excited for Star Wars movies of the future.  I do know that there is still the Han Solo movie in 2018 and the conclusion to this trilogy in 2019\, and I will probably see both in theaters\, but my relationship with Star Wars likely ended with The Last Jedi. I really can't even see myself liking this in future viewing either.  I didn't hate it\, I didn't like it\, it was just kinda...\n\n7 of 10
